speakerBioSummary.text:
• Antoni Porowski is a New York Times bestselling author and star of Netflix’s hit series Queer Eye, which has won “Outstanding Structured Reality Program” for four consecutive years.
  • As the show’s food and wine expert, the self-taught cook brings with him a lifelong passion for food, later honed in restaurants from Montreal to New York and under mentor Ted Allen, original Fab Five food and wine expert.
  • Antoni’s first cookbook, Antoni in the Kitchen, debuted at #2 on the New York Times’ Best Seller List and his follow up, Antoni: Let’s Do Dinner, was released in September 2021.
  • Antoni is developing a feature film entitled Girls and Boys for Netflix with Black-ish creator Kenya Barris, loosely based on Antoni’s real-life dating experiences as a sexually fluid man. 
  • He is an outspoken advocate for LGBTQ+ rights everywhere and serves on the board of the Equaversity Foundation which was established to organize international fundraising to support the LGBTQ+ community in his family’s native Poland.
  • Antoni has graced the covers of Gay Times, Out Magazine, Fashion Magazine, and Entertainment Weekly. A finalist for People’s Choice Reality TV Star of 2019 and 2020 and winner of Eater’s 2018 #Brand of the Year and People’s 2019 Readers’ Choice Sexiest Reality Star, Antoni continues to connect with audiences the world over.

speakerBiography.text:
Antoni Porowski is a New York Times Bestselling Author and star of Netflix’s Emmy Award-winning series Queer Eye. As the show’s food and wine expert, the self-taught cook brings with him a lifelong passion for food. Antoni’s first cookbook Antoni in the Kitchen debuted at #2 on the New York Times’ Best Seller List in 2019. His follow up cookbook, Antoni: Let’s Do Dinner, was released in September 2021.

Antoni can currently be seen in Netflix’s award-winning series Queer Eye, which has won the Emmy Award for “Outstanding Structured Reality Program” for four consecutive years. In 2020 and 2021, Antoni and his fellow Fab Five received Emmy nominations for “Outstanding Hosts For A Reality Or Competition Program.” Antoni also is developing a feature film for Netflix with Black-ish creator Kenya Barris loosely based on Antoni’s real-life dating experiences as a sexually fluid man entitled Girls and Boys.

Born in Canada to Polish emigrants, Antoni is an outspoken advocate for LGBTQ+ rights everywhere, especially in his family’s native Poland where he serves on the board of the Equaversity Foundation which was established to organize international fundraising to support the LGBTQ+ community in Poland.

speakerNameSubheading.text: Food & Wine Connoisseur, Netflix's Queer Eye & Bestselling Author

speakerReview.text: The event was GREAT! Antoni was amazing to work with, the students had a blast, and it was an overall success!
speakerReview.title: review

speakerReview.text: It was really great! Antoni is such a positive role model for students, and it was a pleasure watching him interact with them.

speakerReview.text: We received glowing positive feedback from both students and staff in attendance!
